Instruction: Heat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Cook the garlic in the melted butter in a saucepan over low heat until tender, for about 5 minutes.
Combine bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese, parsley, oregano, pepper, and salt in a shallow bowl.

Coat the chicken breasts with the garlic butter, then press them into the bread crumb mixture. Place the coated chicken in a 9x13 inch baking dish, drizzle with any remaining butter, and sprinkle the top with any remaining bread crumb mixture.
Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the chicken is cooked through and the crust is golden.
